title: New North Hamada Pipeline Boosts Libyan Oil Production
keypoints: A new pipeline from the North Hamada oil field in Libya has commenced operations.
The pipeline, developed by Nafusa Oil Operations, transports oil to the Mellitah oil port.
Production from the North Hamada field is expected to reach 8,000 barrels per day by mid-July and 10,000 barrels per day by next August.
The Libyan National Oil Corporation (NOC) aims to achieve a production rate of 2 million barrels per day by 2030.

title: NNPC Declares State of Emergency on Crude Oil Production
keypoints: NNPC Ltd has declared a state of emergency on crude oil production in Nigeria to increase output and grow reserves.
The declaration was made by the Group Chief Executive Officer, Mr. Mele Kyari, at the Nigeria Oil & Gas Conference and Exhibition.
Nigeria has the potential to produce two million barrels of crude oil per day without new rigs, but delays and other challenges have impeded production.
NNPC Ltd plans to replace old crude oil pipelines and introduce a rig sharing program to improve production efficiency.
NNPC Ltd is committed to investing in critical midstream gas infrastructure and boosting domestic gas production for power generation and industrial development.

title: Crude oil falls after weak Chinese growth
keypoints: Crude oil prices fell slightly due to weak Chinese economic data.
West Texas Intermediate (WTI) dropped from $81.20 to $80.45 per barrel, while Brent crude declined to $83.80 per barrel.
China's year-on-year growth in the second quarter was 4.7%, lower than the forecasted 5.1%.
China's crude oil imports fell by 2.3% in the first half of the year, indicating weaker economic activity.
Despite weak Chinese demand, geopolitical factors have maintained stability in crude oil prices.
